content.description: Perhaps the king line of the cave; amazing movement, possible heartbreak at the lip, and a unique topout make this thing a CT Classic. Do some 27 to 30+ hand moves on beautiful crimps and jugs; if you are a sport climber it feels weird not clipping. Sun is on it from mid morning to noonish.
content.protection: At least 3 pads and a good spotter, 6 to 8 pads with spotter highly recommended, if you blow hard going for the sharp jug some 2/3 inÂ you may tumble out right...
content.location: Start as deep as possible on crimps in a funny sit/stand position and go up to gain the larger juggy crack. Ride the crack rightwards to a series of crimps upwards. Relax on a jug and go up left for the top.

content.description: Lots of meat, rock often sweats, but movement is fun and is a decent warmup. Start and a typically wet slopey jug and climb the crack to gain the lip.
content.location: This climb follows the left most right angling crack up and out of the cave

content.description: A very impressive cave with rock that has cleaned up nicely, a rather unique feature and climbing style for CT. The cave is steep and has a reasonable landing in spots. Several prominent cracks line the cave. Word is that Dan & Dave found this some dozen years back, I hope others will be able to enjoy it. Please tread lightly.
